title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point a response must provide a difference and a quotient. A response of only 2.7−2.5 6.2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40E1@ or 0.2 6.2−0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F67@ earns the first point.

To earn the second point a response must have cm cm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D16@ (or the equivalent) attached to a numerical value. These units do not reduce to 1 because the numerator, cm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaabogacaqGTbaaaa@3AF2@ , refers to radius of the bottle and the denominator, cm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaabogacaqGTbaaaa@3AF2@ , refers to height of the bottle.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point, a response must provide “average,” “radius,” and “the interval from 0 to 20” (or equivalent such as “throughout the bottle” or “from the bottom to the top”). Units are not required to earn the first point.

To earn the second point, at least five of the six factors in the trapezoidal sum must be correct.

If there is any error in the trapezoidal sum, the response does not earn the third point.

A response of 1 20 ( 6.2 ⋅  2.5+2.7 2 +6.8 ⋅  2.7+4.3 2 +7 ⋅  4.3+2.6 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6662@ earns the second and third points, unless there is a subsequent error in simplification, in which case the response would earn only the second point.

A response that is missing the factor of 1 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE1@ in the trapezoidal sum does not earn the second and third points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the second point, a response does not need to provide a value for f ′ (12); MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D82@ the sign of f ′ (12) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC3@ is sufficient.

Any presented value of f ′ (12) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC3@ must be correct for the digits presented, up to three decimal places.

If a response presents an incorrect sign or value for f ′  ( 12 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F34@ the response does not earn the second point.

Degree mode: A response that presents answers obtained by using a calculator in degree mode does not earn the first point it would have otherwise earned. The response is eligible for all subsequent points (unless no answer is possible in degree mode or the question is made simpler by using degree mode). In degree mode, f ′ (12)=− 0.0006660598. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49F1@ If a response presents this value, it earns the first point but is not eligible to earn the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned for a definite integral with an integrand of ( f(h) ) 2 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F59@ regardless of any subsequent errors in presentation of f(h). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbGaaiikaiaadIgacaGGPaGaaiOlaaaa@3CDF@ A response that begins with an error in copying f(h) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbGaaiikaiaadIgacaGGPaaaaa@3C2D@ into an integrand of the form ( f(h) ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E9F@ does not earn the first point, but is eligible to earn the second point for a correct answer ( 1007.112 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EEF@ or 1007.111 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EEE@ ).

An answer of 320.574π MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FDC@ rounds and truncates to 1007.028, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA5@ and therefore does not earn the second point. Similarly, an answer of 320.573π MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FDB@ truncates to 1007.109 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EF5@ and rounds to 1007.110, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F9D@ and therefore does not earn the second point. However, answers of 320.5736π MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40BB@ or 320.5737π MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40BC@ do round and truncate to the correct answer and earn the second point.

Degree mode: π ∫ 0 20 ( f ( h ) ) 2  dh =427.508 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5039@ (or 427.507 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E43@ ) or 136.0799156π. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43B0@ A response that did not earn the second point in part (c) because of degree mode is eligible to earn the answer point in part (d) for this value. Furthermore, in degree mode 136.079π MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4001@ rounds to 427.505 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E40@ and truncates to 427.504, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EEF@ and therefore does not earn the second point. However, in degree mode 136.080π MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FF9@ is accurate to three decimals and is eligible for the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
